title: Python/Big data developer
raw_desc:
Job Description

About Capgemini

A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion (about $15.6 billion USD at 2018 average rate).

Visit us at . People matter, results count.

Job Description

  • In depth understanding and knowledge of Hadoop and Spark architecture and RDD transformation

    Proven experience in developing solutions using Spark architecture and PySpark for data engineering pipelines, transformation and aggregation of data from variety of sources into data lake.

    Atleast 3 or more years of relevant experience in developing PySpark programs using APIs. Expertise in different file formats like parquet, ORC.

    Experience with troubleshooting, fine tuning Spark and python based applications for scalability and performance.

    Experience in designing hive tables to handle velocity, variety and to handle huge volumes.

    Experience in data ingestion, processing and analyzing data using Spark/SQL from disparate sources.

    Knowledge in using Spark-Submit and Spark UI. Experience in creating and then performing operations on Spark RDD.

    Experience in creating Spark Data Frames from RDD, HIVE and Parquet files and then performing Joins and Aggregations on Dataframes.

    Experience in processing data from Python and other API modules.

What we offer

Your career matters to you and is important to us too. Because your goals and needs are constantly evolving, we offer visibility, leeway and support to help you grow and progress in your career. This approach builds notably on our comprehensive competency framework, our personal development, training and career management programs, and our University innovative and business-focused learning curriculums.

We promote a culture of diversity. We believe working with talented individuals from different backgrounds and points of view is a strategic advantage and an ongoing opportunity. Diversity enriches our creative solutions and adds value for our clients.

With the digital tech sector growing at a rapid pace and women significantly underrepresented in the industry, we are determined to inspire and recruit more women into technology and build diverse teams that reflect the clients we serve.

Our Shared values have been at the heart of the group since our formation. They are honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, team spirit, modesty and fun. These values influence the way we meet client needs while respecting the regulatory requirements of each country in which we operate, and the way we promote ethically sound practices within Capgemini and in our partnerships.

Capgemini is committed to building a workforce of employees with diverse backgrounds and work experiences. We strongly encourage women, veterans and active military service personnel to apply.

Disclaimer

Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.

This is a general description of the Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications required for this position. Physical, mental, sensory or environmental demands may be referenced in an attempt to communicate the manner in which this position traditionally is performed. Whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity, Capgemini will consider reasonable accommodations that might involve varying job requirements and/or changing the way this job is performed, provided that such accommodations do not pose an undue hardship.

Click the following link for more information on your rights as an Applicant -

Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now and/or will not in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US by Capgemini.

title: Java or C++ or Python Developer
job_desc:
The Currencies and Commodities business consolidates and expands the firm's electronic market making and algorithmic trade execution. Our team of engineers builds solutions to the most complex problems. We develop cutting-edge systems and processes that form the core of our key business and enable transactions to move in milliseconds. We provide real-time access to critical deal information and crunch billions of data points each day to inform firm-wide market insights and strategies. Team members have the opportunity to work at the forefront of technology innovation alongside industry leaders and make significant contributions to the field.
THis covers FX, Commodities, Interest Rates, and Credit. We are growing our team focused on development for post-execution services for clients and desktop applications used by Trading and Sales internally to manage electronic trading flows across the businesses. This is a great opportunity to make an impact in a specialized team of engineers working with a dynamic and exciting business.

Job Summary

On a daily basis, we work with Trading and Sales to improve our Electronic Trading platforms by defining and delivering software to provide clients with post execution services which help them manage their risk and transactions more efficiently
In this team, you will gain a comprehensive understanding of electronic trading across multiple asset classes ranging from high volume FX trading to complex derivatives in Commodities
You will work with various technologies including Java, C++, Linux, RDMSs and a proprietary programming language

title: Object Oriented Developer (Python)
job_desc:
A large investment bank in NYC is looking to bring on several python developers.

 

Global Markets Operations Technology is creating a new application in support of Collateral Management. The main areas of development will be new interfaces for receiving collateral trade data, market data, master agreement information, and collateral movement events for both securities and cash. The required skills of this Senior Developer are to be strong in an object-oriented programming language (7+ years) and have comparable experience in a key development role. He/she must demonstrate a track record of delivering mission-critical applications on-time. Knowledge of capital markets, collateral, or experience building new applications for the financial industry is a big plus. The candidate must be able to understand and clearly communicate (verbal and written) complex technical concepts. The candidate must be a well established object-oriented programmer. This project will be written using the Python language. We are not requiring the candidate to have Python experience (although huge plus if they are) as long as they are that establish OO programmer and is willing to learn the Python language.

Job Description and Responsibilities/Additional Information

 

  • 7 years Object Oriented Programming
  • 3+ years as an application developer using core PYTHON 3.7, JAVA or C#
  • 3+ years experience in Agile Software development methodologies
  • 2+ years in development of Financial application

title: Object Oriented Developer (python)
job_desc:
A Fortune 500 Company is looking to bring on several python developers.

 

ABOUT THE PROJECT:

Zinc requires a software engineer to assist with the delivery of high profile business analysis products. We are using Python and an Oracle Exadata back end to collect data from around the firm for reporting and analytics. Core to the project is a proprietary data warehouse solution and custom reports so any experience with data warehousing, aggregation and Tableau will be an advantage.

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:

A successful candidate must have solid python development experience and some comfort with SQL and Relational databases. UNIX shell scripting or programming languages such as Ruby or C will be of use as will prior exposure to Tableau. The candidate must have a proven track record in contributing to enterprise project deliveries preferably within a financial institution.

At this level, the candidate should expect to contribute to design discussions with the other members of the development team, conform to team process, including test-driven development and source code control practices, and have the confidence to interact directly with user when trouble shooting any issues with the production system. The candidate should be equally comfortable working closely with the lead developer and independently under their own initiative.

title: Object Oriented (Python)
job_desc:
A large investment bank in NYC is looking to bring on several python developers.

 

Description:

We are looking to fill a Python developer position in the risk development team. Here is what we are looking for in a candidate:
1. Eager to learn

title: Data Engineer(Java & Python)
job_desc:
Infostretch is a digital-first professional services firm. By combining in-depth experience with ready-made tools, frameworks, technologies, and partnerships, Infostretch helps enterprises get digital right, the first time. With an experienced team of digital technologists, Infostretch offers Digital Strategy, Digital Development, DevOps, Quality Engineering, Cloud, IoT, Data Analytics and Mobility services. The company is trusted by leading Fortune 100 companies as well as emerging innovators to deliver solutions that work seamlessly across channels, leverage predictive analytics to optimize the software lifecycle, and support continuous innovation.

Infostretch is seeking a Senior Data Engineer with hands on experience in Java and Python. This position is based in New York City, NY.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to the architecture, design and development of our Python and Java data workflow management platform
  • Design and develop tools to wrangle datasets of small and large volumes of data into cleaned, normalized, and enriched datasets
  • Work with the product group and data engineering to develop new functionality
  • Should have knowledge about OO Python and Java.
  • Experience working independently, or with minimal guidance
  • Experience with agile software development.
  • Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
  • Experience working with Distributed Systems design and implementation.

Positive points:

  • RDBMS SQL and NOSQL, structured and unstructured data.
  • Big data and cloud processing experience, e.g. HDFS, Spark
  • Experience working in a cloud-based environment, such as GCP or AWS
  • Experience with pandas and numpy
  • Proficiency in multiple programming languages

Education Qualification:

  • B.S. in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or related area of study

An excellent salary and bonus package is just the start with an Infostretch career. We also provide medical, dental, vision, 401k with company match, company paid life insurance, paid time off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, gym reimbursement is standard here. Add to that annual performance evaluations, company parties and family picnics and you ve got a career that continually rewards your effort. There s nothing more important to our success than our employees and we prove it every day.

This is a direct hire fulltime position. If you feel that this is a good match for your skillsets - please send a current word version of your resume along with contact information. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)

You are a creative and analytical technologist who evangelizes TDD/BDD, DevOps, CI/CD, with a drive to automate whatever you can. Join a like-minded and passionate team of diverse engineers in building a massively-scalable software as a service.

The core development Stack is Python, Flask, JS, Node, React, Kafka, ElasticSearch, MySQL, Postgres, AWS, Terraform, Linux, Lookr, Datadog, etc. Th e process is language agnostic but python is a huge plus.

Our client offers a competitive package including salary, full benefits (medical, dental, vision 100% covered for the individual), a casual work environment, equity, etc.

  • Write unit, integration, and system-level tests; Automate as much as possible
  • Design and deploy infrastructure in the cloud - Terraform, AWS, GCP
  • Implement, maintain and automate systems monitoring
  • Support and administer Redshift, MySql, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, and Redis
  • Troubleshoot and resolve outages, bottlenecks and performance issues
  • Design, develop, architect complex distributed systems
  • Fanatical about writing clear and concise documentation
  • Collaborate with the team and mentor junior developers
  • Participate in the engineering planning process

Requirements

  • College Degree in computer science, computer engineering or similar is preferred
  • 6 years building high availability, distributed, web-services in Python, Go, Java, or PHP, Javascript,
  • Expert knowledge of microservices, web architecture, API's and frameworks
  • Experience in big data environments and stream processing; expert with data structures, Schema, and models
  • Experience with Github, Docker, Amazon ECS, Jenkins, New Relic, Paper Trail, Lookr, etc.

title: Python Developer | Financial
job_desc:
We are directly working with the hiring manager and looking for a Python Developer for our direct client in financial industry.

Duration: Permanent/Fulltime with the client.

Location: New York City

Required skills and Experience:

Our direct client in financial industry looking for a Fulltime Python Developer (Python, C#, .Net) in the research team, you will be building the tools, frameworks, libraries and applications which power our Systematic Research and Trading. This includes responsibility for the continued success of the existing platform, and its evolution as we continually expand the markets and types of assets we trade, and the styles in which we trade them. Your challenges will be varied and might involve building new high-performance data acquisition and processing pipelines, cloud-computing solutions, numerical algorithms, visualization and reporting tools, operational user interfaces, continuous build systems and other developer productivity tools.

Responsibilities and Qualifications of Software Developer

  • 8+ years of Software engineering experience, our tech stack includes primarily Python, C++, .Net, C#, Microsoft SQL Server is Must!!!!
  • Proficient with a range of open source frameworks and development tools e.g. Python -NumPy/SciPy/Pandas, AngularJS, Flink, Spark, etc
  • Experience / understanding of usage of Machine Learning / AI principles in data engineering: data profiling, intelligent alerts, data interpretation & curation using Python.
  • Expert Python consultant with around 2 years of proven expertise in delivering large projects and applications.
  • Expertise in writing and reviewing good code quality using SONAR, Pylint etc.
  • Knowledge of the entire Python ecosystem including JENKINS, SONAR, GIT, bitbucket, CI/CD etc.,
  • Experienced in data warehousing and big data implementations ( Cloudera- Hive, Hadoop..) and technologies is a plus!

title: Python Developer - Equities...
job_desc:
Who We Are

We are the front-office Strategies group of a preeminent investment bank supporting Equities Automated trading. Core Strats design and develop complex parallel computing architectures, electronic trading tools, and advanced algorithms. The Infrastructure Strats team monitors and maintains the firm's automated trading systems. This critical role includes analysis and support for real-time trading issues as well as proactive work towards automation.

Tools and Automation

The Tools and Automation team improves and enhances operability and tooling around firm's automated trading systems. This critical role involves building state of the art monitoring and analysis tools to ensure the high-speed trading plant is operating optimally. Our infrastructure is responsible for ensuring that the firm's equity trading algos are operating as expected. We are building tools to analyze and optimize the algo's that the firm's customers rely on for high volume trading.

The team will use state of the art techniques to instrument and control the firm's production environment. This individual will be involved in green field development of the firm's modern tooling, one of the most relevant areas in technology as systems expand in complexity. 

Resposibilities

  • Work to understand existing and new trading applications and processes
  • Translate unstructured inefficiencies and pain points into concrete business and technical requirements
  • Develop tools and automate workflows
  • Write well-designed, efficient, readable, and extensible code
  • Evaluate, become expert in, and recommend new technologies in order to solve problems
  • Acquire knowledge of financial markets and use it to recommend and implement enhancements and improvements to our electronic trading product offering

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field
  • At least 2 years of work experience in a similar role or demonstrate equivalent development expertise in software development (tools and automation)
  • At least 2 years of software development experience in C++/Java programming language
  • Hands on experience with Unix/Linux and Perl/Python or an equivalent scripting language
  • Sound knowledge of an RDBMS like Sybase or Oracle and SQL expertise
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Note: Domain knowledge of US Equities and/or Options trading a plus.

 Who We Look For

You will have a passion for efficiency and automation and continually look for ways to improve daily tasks. You will have a strong interest in financial markets and use this knowledge, together with the insight you gain from managing the production environment, to recommend and implement enhancements and improvements to our electronic trading product offering. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.

title: Software Engineering Manager /...
job_desc:
2bridge Partners has been engaged in the search for a direct-hire Engineering Manager. Our client is looking for a Software Engineer and player-coach who is driven to improve their products, technology solutions, and engineering team.  Anticipate the mix of hands-on development vs leadership to be 60/40.  

They are a fast-moving, and agile company, committed to employing testing, automation, and CI/CD best practices while building data-driven, distributed applications on a massive scale.
They offer a competitive package including base, bonus, medical, dental, vision, and Paid Time off. Must be authorized to work for any employer in the USA.

Responsibilities:

  • Write clean, efficient and reusable code in Python, Django/Flask, and React.
  • Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests ensuring quality and ease of deployment.
  • Tackle technical debt in the code and refactor as necessary.
  • Manage and mentor the team, perform code reviews, participate in pairs programming exercises and generally work to ensure professional growth. Participate in the recruitment process.
  • Take a leadership role in software planning - create JIRA tickets, estimate time to resolution, test features, etc.
  • Work to build and enhance relationships between the business & technical stakeholders
  • Establish and adhere to best practices using a data-driven approach
  • Lead sprints and sprint planning
  • In collaboration with the broader technical team, own your team's vision and align against SLA's. 

Requirements:

  • Undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science or another relevant discipline.
  • Polyglot developer experience building largescale systems in Python, JS, React, Redux or another language. 
  • At least 2+ years in sprint planning and leadership
  • Experience in recruitment, management, and mentorship of technical contributors including one on ones, performance reviews, etc. 
  • Experience creating features specifications, designing data models and API endpoints.
  • Experience with CI/CD tools and cloud services - Docker, Jenkins, Terraform, AWS, Lambda, etc.

title: Senior / Lead Python Engineer -...
job_desc:
2Bridge Partners has been engaged in the search for a direct-hire, full time, Software Engineer with a focus on Data Ops, to join our growing FinTech client. Join a team of exceptional, obsessive engineers, building a cloud-based API technology intended to improve access to the financial markets and empowering clients to clear, settle and finance trading activity while gaining real-time risk and position information.

The platform is built on a modern tech-stack and will give clients unparalleled efficiency and real-time data insights. The Environment: Go, Python, JS, React, Typescript, Rest, Kafka, LINUX, AWS, Lambda, Docker, Kubernetes, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Postgres, EC2, Redshift, Pandas, R, SQL, etc.


The process is language and tech agnostic but focused on finding someone experienced in the design, configuration, architecture, and support of large scale, distributed cloud-based systems and services.

Build the platforms that enable operations to work at maximum efficiency and power all analytical efforts. In this capacity, you will engineer elegant solutions to optimize and automate repetitive processes. You will help launch data pipelines that transform and transport data across the platform, as well as research and implement the analytics environment.

Characteristics:

  • You live by the integrity of the data flowing through systems - you define metrics and measurements and build frameworks to validate and monitor data quality.
  • You are skilled at writing SQL queries and manipulating data with Pandas.
  • You write elegant python code and advanced scripts to automate processes
  • You are a champion of the latest data technologies and frameworks and work to build tools that empower researchers and maximize insight.
  • You have deep knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals.
  • You have a passion for finance and strive to understand the intricacies of the markets.


We offer:

  • Join a small and growing team of good people where you will make a difference
  • A high-quality code base with no technical debt and the ability to build new services and features
  • A focus on DevOps and emphasis on CI/CD methodology is part of their culture
  • A collaborative and meritocratic company; your work will be rewarded
  • Competitive compensation, benefits, and perks

I.T. Associates perform moderately complex professional work in technology-related disciplines. While areas of specialization vary, typically I.T. Associates work in areas such as development/programming, communications, technical support, or similar functions depending on the needs of the Information Technology area to which they report. Work tasks include resolving complex technology problems and serving as a technical resource. They have considerable latitude for independent initiative and judgment and may have supervisory responsibilities.

I.T. Associates should demonstrate mastery of one or more technology-related disciplines.

This job is in CUNY's Classified Civil Service. The full specification is available on our web site at
http://www.cuny.edu/about/administration/offices/ohrm/hros/classification/ccsjobs.html
CONTRACT TITLE
IT Associate
FLSA
Exempt
CAMPUS SPECIFIC INFORMATION
The CUNY School of Professional Studies (CUNY SPS) provides online and on campus degree and certificate programs that meet the needs of adults who are looking to finish or transition into a bachelor s degree, earn a master s degree or certificate in a specialized field, advance in the workplace, or change careers.

Home to the first fully online degree programs at the City University of New York, CUNY SPS offers fully accredited degree and certificate programs for students who want the flexibility and convenience of online education. CUNY SPS was ranked in the top 5% in the Nation in U.S. News & World Report s list of the 2019 Best Online Bachelor s Degree Programs.

Drawing on CUNY's nationally and internationally renowned faculty and practitioners, as well as industry and education partners, the School's programs provide opportunities for personal growth, job mobility, greater civic participation, and new ways to advance knowledge.
The Office of Information Technology provides technology, help-desk, and systems services for all of the School s online and classroom-based programs, as well as for its administrative operations.

This mid-level software developer position will report directly to the Software Development Manager and in addition to the General Duties, will assist in various aspects of the software development process, including, but not limited to, data collections, technology software evaluations, user guide documentations, programming development, software deployments, and software integrations. Other responsibilities include:

Experience implementing code with web framework, handling the frontend UI and backend business logics, including db calls, caching, and server configurations.
Experience in full stack development building web server both in Ubuntu and Windows operating systems for production, staging, and personal dev environment.
Implement scripts to support software and data processing.
Experience building normalized and reporting databases.
Work with the development team to design, adapt, and implement new and existing software solutions to support the staff, faculty and administration of CUNY SPS.
Use continuous integration tools to develop application test and deployment pipelines.
Create technical documents and non-technical user instructional guides for application software.
Integrate third party application with existing CUNY SPS environment.
Provide IT professional perspective evaluations on software for other departments.
Collaborate with technical and non-technical users on software implementation.
Assist in implementing and maintaining test, deployments, continuous integration, continuous delivery systems, service monitoring solutions, and log analysis tools.
Complete other duties as assigned by the Software Development Manager.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  1. High School Diploma, G.E.D., or equivalent

    2. An equivalent of seven years of experience post-high school that can be met by one of the following: seven years of full-time work experience in a computer or technology related position; an Associate's degree plus five years of full-time work experience in a computer or technology-related position; a Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution plus three years of full-time work experience in a computer or technology-related position

    3. Demonstrated English Language proficiency

    4. A Motor Vehicle Driver's license, valid in New York State, may be required for some, but not all positions.


This job has three levels. To qualify for Levels 2 and 3, additional qualifications, such as education, experience, or certification relevant to the area of specialization are required.
OTHER QUALIFICATIONS
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Proficient in web development in PHP, Python, C#, and ASP.Net
Proficient in setting up full stack web applications in Linux and Windows operating systems.
Strong in HTML5, DOM, CSS2, Javascript, Jquery, Ajax, XML, JSON, Nginx, Microdata tagging, and XDebug
Knowledgeable in Database development and administration with SQL Server, MySQL, and MariaDB.
Experience in automating application deployment with Vagrant and Salt.
Experience in source control, such as Git, SVN, and CVS.
Strong understanding of application networking, security, and administration.
Knowledgeable with the QA tools, such as Selenium and other free open source applications.
COMPENSATION
Salary: $ 78,115
BENEFITS
CUNY offers a comprehensive benefits package to employees and eligible dependents based on job title and classification. Employees are also offered pension and Tax-Deferred Savings Plans. Part-time employees must meet a weekly or semester work hour criteria to be eligible for health benefits. Health benefits are also extended to retirees who meet the eligibility criteria.
HOW TO APPLY
Visit www.cuny.edu , access the employment page, log in or create a new user account, and search for this vacancy using Job ID# 21396 or the Title. Select "Apply Now" and provide the requested information.
CLOSING DATE
December 21, 2019

CUNY Job Posting: Information Technology/Technical

title: Enterprise Data Manager
job_desc:
ACA Compliance Group ( ACA ) is a leading provider of risk management and technology solutions that focus on regulatory compliance, performance, financial crime, and cybersecurity. We partner with our clients to help them mitigate the regulatory, operational, and reputational risks inherent in their business functions. Our clients include leading investment advisers, private fund managers, commodity trading advisors, investment companies, broker-dealers, and domestic and international banks.

Position Objective :

The newly created role of Enterprise Data Manager will develop, design and implement a Master Data Framework at ACA. This position will manage and master enterprise data across functions, while establishing the appropriate governance, technology, standards, processes and policy for the organization. The primary object of the individual in this position is to ensure that information flows timely and securely to and from the organization as well as within. This role supports enterprise data both at the enterprise and business unit level. This role is responsible for the day to day coordination and execution of projects and support for the enterprise data program within ACA.

A great data manager is able to fully grasp the complexity of data management. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of databases, data warehouses and data analysis procedures.

  • Lead the establishment and documentation of technology direction and standards for data platforms, involving all aspects of information access and retrieval, integration, middleware translators, utilities, tools, and languages for use by information technology groups. Communicate the benefits and advocate the use of enterprise wide data architecture and standard platforms, products and tools to senior management, business area staff and technical staff.
  • Analyze the current state innovation, product development and manufacturing operating model, including organizational constructs, business processes, systems, information and data
  • Analyze, design and implement new/improved operational capabilities in our master data architecture.
  • Defines and achieves the strategy roadmap for the enterprise; including data modeling, implementation and data management for our enterprise data warehouse and advanced data analytics systems.
  • Evangelize Data Governance and value of accurate master
  • Develops and implements strategies for data warehouse following industry best practice, creating conceptual, logical and physical models.
  • Expert in data warehousing principles utilizing fact and dimension tables, star and snowflake schema data modeling and data normalization preferred.
  • Provide support to enterprise data infrastructure management and analysts throughout the project cycle to ensure development of efficient data systems utilizing established standards, procedures and methodologies (i.e. design reviews, architect reviews).
  • Drive the execution of data architecture using industry best practices. Specifically - Provide technical and architectural guidance to teams across all platforms and infrastructures, including promoting adherence to design standards and methodologies.
  • Applies extensive knowledge of business drivers, technology strategy, architecture goals and infrastructure to develop and deliver clear, comprehensive data, technical and product architectures. Reviews and ensures major data designs are consistent, maintainable, flexible and cost effective.
  • Investigates and forecasts market trends to define the technical information strategy direction and recommends innovations that anticipate the future direction of the business, its drivers and technology strategy.
  • Recommend emerging technological solutions to increase market share and reduce operational costs.
  • Conduct systems architecture studies of new and existing data infrastructure; develop tactical plans to address short-term deficiencies in current data architecture.
  • Review project plans and technical documents to ensure consistency, accuracy and compliance with enterprise data architecture.
    • Bachelor s Degree required major in Computer Science or Management of Information Systems preferred.
    • 5-10 years of experience in technologies relevant to data/information management, such as SQL, MDM, Metadata, Data Quality, etc.
    • Has a broad level of understanding surrounding information systems and application architecture standards.
    • Experience in leading small project teams and streams.
    • Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools
    • Experience with big data tools and experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases
    • Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, NodeJS
    • Demonstrated professional integrity
    • Dependable, flexible, and adaptable to new ACA initiatives and changing client needs
    • Ability to work well in a fast-paced, small-team environment
    • Ability to work independently, multi-task and prioritize effectively
    • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with colleagues and clients
    • Highly motivated and goal oriented; proactive in one s own education and career progression; volunteers for and shows initiative on both internal and external projects and tasks

    With over 700 employees worldwide, ACA provides services to over 4,000 regional, national, and global firms in the financial services industry. ACA clients include 89% of the top 100 hedge fund managers (Hedge Fund Alert, April 2019), 79% of the top 100 private equity firms (PEI 300, May 2019, 83% of America s top 100 money managers (Institutional Investor, 2018), 78% of the top 50 real estate firms (PERE 100, June 2019), 79% of the top 100 Mutual Funds (Mutual Fund Directory 2019).

    ACA is an equal opportunity employer and does not unlawfully discriminate against current or prospective employees on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, pregnancy, familial status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, citizenship, ancestry, genetic information, or any other characteristics prohibited by law.

job_desc:
We are directly working with the hiring manager and looking for a Full Stack Developer (C#, .Net) for our direct client in financial industry.

Duration: Permanent/Fulltime with the client

Location: New York City

Required skills and Experience:

Our direct client in financial industry looking for a Fulltime Full Stack Developer (C#, .Net, Python) in the research team, you will be building the tools, frameworks, libraries and applications which power our Systematic Research and Trading. This includes responsibility for the continued success of the existing platform, and its evolution as we continually expand the markets and types of assets we trade, and the styles in which we trade them. Your challenges will be varied and might involve building new high-performance data acquisition and processing pipelines, cloud-computing solutions, numerical algorithms, visualization and reporting tools, operational user interfaces, continuous build systems and other developer productivity tools.

Responsibilities and Qualifications of Software Developer

8+ years of Software engineering experience, our tech stack includes primarily C#, .Net, Microsoft SQL Server is Must!!!!
Familiarity with a variety of programming styles (e.g. OO, functional) and in-depth knowledge of design patterns.

Proficient with a range of open source frameworks and development tools e.g. NumPy/SciPy/Pandas, AngularJS, Flink, Spark, etc is a plus!

Solid understanding of high performing data structures, distributed systems, and modern distributed data pipeline technologies.
Implement web interfaces, API's and RESTful services.
Work closely with infrastructure to build high scale backend services.
Refining, and increasing automation of the research infrastructure in all its components.
Collaborate with the rest of the engineering team to design and launch new features.
Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications.
Maintain code integrity and organization.
A proponent of strong collaborative software engineering techniques and methods: agile development, continuous integration, code review, unit testing, refactoring and related approaches.

title: Data Ops Support
job_desc:
Infostretch is a digital-first professional services firm. By combining in-depth experience with ready-made tools, frameworks, technologies, and partnerships, Infostretch helps enterprises get digital right, the first time. With an experienced team of digital technologists, Infostretch offers Digital Strategy, Digital Development, DevOps, Quality Engineering, Cloud, IoT, Data Analytics and Mobility services. The company is trusted by leading Fortune 100 companies as well as emerging innovators to deliver solutions that work seamlessly across channels, leverage predictive analytics to optimize the software lifecycle, and support continuous innovation.

Infostretch is seeking a Senior Data Engineer (Data Ops Support). This position is based in New York City NY.

Responsibility:

  • First level contact for incidents/issue reporting
  • Customer Interaction with via Email. Each support person to have pager and cell phone.
  • Gather the details about the issue faced i.e. problem description and logging an incident/ticket for the same in the Incident management system.
  • Send Acknowledgement of incident to client based on the Priority and Severity of the ticket. Response time will depend on the SLAs defined.
  • Analyze the issue/incident and try to find the root cause or gather logs and attach it with ticket. If not resolved then send the ticket to L2 support team. Update status to customer.
  • Monitor DAGs in production daily at regular interval. In case of failures, analyze them and either re-run DAG or log a ticket for L2 support with
  • Interaction with L2 and L3 team to get status of each incidents on daily basis with ETA for resolution. Accordingly customer can be updated on status.
  • Support Lead to provide Daily Status Report of
  • Incidents either through Report Dashboard in place by Crux (maybe PagerDuty) or via email.

Technical and Soft skills required are:

  • Understanding of Incident management process
  • Good verbal and written communication
  • Data analysis skills
  • Understanding of pipeline code/configurations
  • Understanding of Airflow and Google Cloud Platform
  • Kubernetes knowledge will be plus.
  • Python and Python API knowledge (Beginner level) is plus
  • ETL Knowledge is plus

Education Qualification:

  • B.S. in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or related area of study

An excellent salary and bonus package is just the start with an Infostretch career. We also provide medical, dental, vision, 401k with company match, company paid life insurance, paid time off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, gym reimbursement is standard here. Add to that annual performance evaluations, company parties and family picnics and you ve got a career that continually rewards your effort. There s nothing more important to our success than our employees and we prove it every day.

This is a direct hire fulltime position. If you feel that this is a good match for your skillsets - please send a current word version of your resume along with contact information. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)

title: Software Development Team Lead
job_desc:
OptionMetrics is seeking a Software Development Team Lead to join our NYC office to mentor and provide direction to a team of software engineers while remaining hands-on with coding. You'll be working alongside exceptionally creative and intelligent developers and quants, collaborating daily to brainstorm and implement our next generation of data and analytic information products. You'll also use your development expertise to architect scalable designs for applications accessing large financial data sets. We're small, agile, casual (no suits – shoes optional), and passionate about our mission and the projects we create. Since we are self-funded and profitable (no VC's!), we can afford to take the long view, emphasizing quality over expediency in all we do. As a member of our development team, you will have true ownership over your projects from beginning to end, with an emphasis on accountability over micromanagement.
Our Technology Stack:
  • Languages: Java, Python, C#, C++
  • Databases: Postgres, SQLite, MS SQL Server, AWS Redshift
  • Frameworks: Spring Boot, Angular
  • Data Analysis: AWS EMR/Hive, Spark, Athena
The Software Development Team Lead Will:
  • Have at least 6 years of experience in software engineering with demonstrated experience leading a team of developers
  • Have 1 - 2 years of experience mentoring and providing direction to junior developers
  • Develop applications accessing large financial data sets
  • Participate in code reviews and assist with the troubleshooting of production support issues
  • Enjoy the challenge of researching data issues to maintain quality in our large data sets
  • Gain an understanding of the complex math associated with options
What We Offer:
  • A collaborative environment where everyone's input makes a difference
  • Paid time off: Vacation, Personal, Sick days, and Holidays
  • Pre-tax commuter benefits (NJT, MTA, etc.) and 401k plan offered
  • Full medical and dental insurance coverage
  • A bright, open office in Midtown Manhattan near Columbus Circle and steps from Central Park with a great view of Times Square
  • The usual drinks and snacks (and we're still small enough to celebrate everyone's birthday with cake!)
OptionMetrics began 20 years ago with the goal of becoming the world's most trusted provider of financial information and research derived from the option markets. Today, our data and analytics models are used in over 350 investment banks, hedge funds, asset management firms, and academic institutions worldwide.

title: Sr. Software Engineer
raw_desc:
Job Description

About this role







BlackRock is one of the world s preeminent asset management firms and a premier provider of global investment management, risk management and advisory services to institutional, intermediary and individual investors around the world. BlackRock offers a range of solutions from rigorous fundamental and quantitative active management approaches aimed at maximizing outperformance to highly efficient indexing strategies designed to gain broad exposure to the world s capital markets. Our clients can access our investment solutions through a variety of product structures, including individual and institutional separate accounts, mutual funds and other pooled investment vehicles, and the industry-leading iShares ETFs.





Business Unit Overview:





Aladdin is the enterprise investment platform used by BlackRock and our clients to manage trillions in holdings across varied asset classes at locations around the world. The Platform Engineering team is tasked with developing our core technology platform including our messaging infrastructure, data services, developer tools and data science platform. Aladdin Studio is an ecosystem for integrating with, enhancing and collaborating on Aladdin. We combine comprehensive APIs, a rich data warehouse platform and elastic compute to democratize data and engage with developers internally and at our clients.







Role description





The Aladdin Studio team engineer high performance, cloud-native applications using commercial, in-house and open source tools. We believe in writing small testable code with a focus on innovation. We are committed to open source and we regularly contribute our work back to the community. We are agile and our stack includes Kubernetes, docker, serverless, helm, gRPC, Argo, Elastic, CouchDB, Cassandra. We pick the right language for the task but frequently work in Go, Python, Java and Node





As a senior engineer in the compute team, you will be building out the Aladdin Compute Platform with a specific focus on realizing our elastic compute framework which aids researchers, portfolio managers, traders and others across the firm to build, test, deploy and scale their research or data science workflows. You will also play a major role in architecting highly decoupled systems and have industry experience with CI/CD best practices, implementing large scale distributed systems etc. You should also be able to work independently and collaboratively while executing efficiently.







Key responsibilities:



  • Identify opportunities to improve the performance, stability and resilience of our compute platform

  • Work with stakeholders and operators to prioritize new features

  • Improve the quality of our software through peer reviews, improving our automated testing capabilities and coaching junior team members

  • Collaborate with the broader Studio team on data, APIs and user experience

  • Improve the monitoring, telemetry and tracing capabilities of our compute platform

  • Engage with partners across the platform on standards and design

  • Continue to automate build and deployment models to improve our development agility

  • Assist with refining our agile methodology





Skills, experience and education:



  • 5+ years' experience in software development with specific experience working with a service oriented architecture.

  • Kubernetes, Docker, serverless, gRPC, Argo, Kubeflow, S3, Python, Java, Go.

  • Experience working with an agile team

  • Independent thinker capable of taking a project from concept to delivery

  • Awareness of current technology trends in elastic compute and workload orchestration

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; presents ideas in a clear, concise and constructive manner

  • Experience working across organizational teams to understand platform needs and develop a strategic roadmap

  • Passionate about open source technology

  • Desire for constant learning

About BlackRock





BlackRock s purpose is to help more and more people experience financial well-being.As a fiduciary to investors and a leading provider of financial technology, our clients turn to us for the solutions they need when planning for their most important goals.As of September 30, 2019, the firm managed approximately $6.96 trillion in assets on behalf of investors worldwide.





For additional information on BlackRock, please visitwww.blackrock.com/corporate| Twitter:@blackrock|



Blog:www.blackrockblog.com| LinkedIn:www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock







BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.







BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Business Unit Overview:





Aladdin is the enterprise investment platform used by BlackRock and our clients to manage trillions in holdings across varied asset classes at locations around the world. The Platform Engineering team is tasked with developing our core technology platform including our messaging infrastructure, data services, developer tools and data science platform. Aladdin Studio is an ecosystem for integrating with, enhancing and collaborating on Aladdin. We combine comprehensive APIs, a rich data warehouse platform and elastic compute to democratize data and engage with developers internally and at our clients.







Role description





The Aladdin Studio team engineer high performance, cloud-native applications using commercial, in-house and open source tools. We believe in writing small testable code with a focus on innovation. We are committed to open source and we regularly contribute our work back to the community. We are agile and our stack includes Kubernetes, docker, serverless, helm, gRPC, Argo, Elastic, CouchDB, Cassandra. We pick the right language for the task but frequently work in Go, Python, Java and Node





As a senior engineer in the compute team, you will be building out the Aladdin Compute Platform with a specific focus on realizing our elastic compute framework which aids researchers, portfolio managers, traders and others across the firm to build, test, deploy and scale their research or data science workflows. You will also play a major role in architecting highly decoupled systems and have industry experience with CI/CD best practices, implementing large scale distributed systems etc. You should also be able to work independently and collaboratively while executing efficiently.







Key responsibilities:



  • Identify opportunities to improve the performance, stability and resilience of our compute platform

  • Work with stakeholders and operators to prioritize new features

  • Improve the quality of our software through peer reviews, improving our automated testing capabilities and coaching junior team members

  • Collaborate with the broader Studio team on data, APIs and user experience

  • Improve the monitoring, telemetry and tracing capabilities of our compute platform

  • Engage with partners across the platform on standards and design

  • Continue to automate build and deployment models to improve our development agility

  • Assist with refining our agile methodology





Skills, experience and education:



  • 5+ years' experience in software development with specific experience working with a service oriented architecture.

  • Kubernetes, Docker, serverless, gRPC, Argo, Kubeflow, S3, Python, Java, Go.

  • Experience working with an agile team

  • Independent thinker capable of taking a project from concept to delivery

  • Awareness of current technology trends in elastic compute and workload orchestration

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; presents ideas in a clear, concise and constructive manner

  • Experience working across organizational teams to understand platform needs and develop a strategic roadmap

  • Passionate about open source technology

  • Desire for constant learning

About BlackRock





BlackRock s purpose is to help more and more people experience financial well-being.As a fiduciary to investors and a leading provider of financial technology, our clients turn to us for the solutions they need when planning for their most important goals.As of September 30, 2019, the firm managed approximately $6.96 trillion in assets on behalf of investors worldwide.





For additional information on BlackRock, please visitwww.blackrock.com/corporate| Twitter:@blackrock|



Blog:www.blackrockblog.com| LinkedIn:www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock







BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.







BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

A career at New York Life offers many opportunities. To be part of a growing and successful business. To reach your full potential, whatever your specialty. Above all, to make a difference in the world by helping people achieve financial security. It's a career journey you can be proud of, and you'll find plenty of support along the way. Our development programs range from skill-building to management training, and we value our diverse and inclusive workplace where all voices can be heard. Recognized as one of Fortune's World's Most Admired Companies, New York Life is committed to improving local communities through a culture of employee giving and service, supported by our Foundation . It all adds up to a rewarding career at a company where doing right by our customers is part of who we are, as a mutual company without outside shareholders. We invite you to bring your talents to New York Life, so we can continue to help families and businesses "Be Good At Life." To learn more, please visit LinkedIn , our Newsroom and the Careers page of www.NewYorkLife.com .

The Service Insights Analytics team is seeking an experienced insights analyst that has a passion for working with large datasets. This role will help support return on investment driven projects by providing the Service organization with actionable insights. The Senior Analyst will lead efforts to translate data into actionable insights that can be leveraged to achieve desired business outcomes. The position requires dynamic thinkers that can provide thoughtful and creative recommendations to business stakeholders. The Senior Associate will be expected to lead projects from start to finish and have the technical ability to efficiently query and transform datasets to be leveraged in analyses.

Responsibilities:
  • Leverage SQL/Hive/Python/PySpark/R to extract necessary data and utilize Tableau/Excel/PowerPoint to analyze the results
  • Communicate findings effectively and translate them into recommended actions appropriate for each area of the business
  • Collaborate with data infrastructure team to understand the data intricacies and bring to life new automated, user-friendly tools
  • Handle multiple ad hoc requests simultaneously
  • Design, build, and automate dashboards dashboard for tracking performance of recommendations and campaigns
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand the business and develop data driven insights that are both strategic and operational
  • Formulate insights, championing them and driving them into action


Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree from elite university preferred
  • High school diploma, or GED from an accredited school required
  • 3+ years relevant professional experience in an analytical role
  • Expertise with SQL (Hadoop/Hive/Oracle)
  • Experience with Python or R
  • Experience Tableau
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills - written, visual, and verbal
  • Excellent analytical reasoning and problem-solving skills
  • A collaborative mindset and sense of curiosity is essential
  • Experience with speech analytics platforms (CallMiner, Verint, Nice, Clarabridge)

SF:EF-LS1
#LI-LS1
